metadata.title: 5 Things To Know: July 11, 2025
metadata.description:
CNBC's Melissa Lee delivers the five things investors need to know ahead of Friday's trading session. For access to live and exclusive video from CNBC subscribe to CNBC PRO: https://cnb.cx/42d859g

transcript.full_text: Five things to know ahead of today's opening bell. President Trump announcing tariffs on imports from Canada of 35% effective August 1st. In a letter to Prime Minister Mark Carney posted on Truth Social, Trump attributed Fentanyl as the reason for the higher rate. Secretary of State Marco Rubio met with China's Foreign Minister in Malaysia today. It's their first in-person meeting as trade tensions between the two countries continue. After the meeting, Rubio said a summit between President Trump and Xi is likely. And Google has reportedly reached a deal to provide cloud computing services for the US government at a heavily discounted price. The Financial Times reports the deal could be finalized within weeks. Oracle cut a similar deal last week. Apple is planning a slate of new product releases for the first half of 2026 including a new low-end iPhone, multiple iPads, and upgraded Mac computers. That's according to a Bloomberg report citing people familiar with Apple's plans. And Flutter Entertainment has reached a deal to take full ownership of sports betting platform FanDuel. It's buying Boyd Gaming's 5% stake in the company for $1.76 billion. The deal values FanDuel at $31 billion. Flutter says FanDuel holds 43% of the sports betting market. So, there's no, uh,

analysis.summary:
The broadcast provides an overview of several key business and political developments. President Trump has announced new 35% tariffs on imports from Canada, effective August 1st, citing Fentanyl as the reason in a letter to Prime Minister Mark Carney posted on Truth Social. This move signals a significant shift in trade relations with Canada.

In international diplomacy, Secretary of State Marco Rubio held his first in-person meeting with China's Foreign Minister in Malaysia, amidst ongoing trade tensions. Following the discussion, Rubio suggested that a summit between President Trump and Chinese leader Xi is a likely next step. Domestically, Google is reportedly close to finalizing a deal to provide cloud computing services to the US government at a heavily discounted rate, a week after Oracle secured a similar agreement.

Looking ahead, Apple is preparing for a major product launch in the first half of 2026, which is expected to include a new low-end iPhone, several iPads, and updated Mac computers, according to a Bloomberg report. Finally, in the sports betting industry, Flutter Entertainment is set to gain full ownership of FanDuel by acquiring Boyd Gaming's remaining 5% stake for $1.76 billion, valuing FanDuel at an impressive $31 billion. Flutter highlights FanDuel's dominant position, holding 43% of the sports betting market.

key_points.text: The segment introduces five key things to know before the opening bell.
President Trump announced tariffs on imports from Canada.
The tariffs imposed on Canadian imports are set at 35%.
The new tariffs will be effective starting August 1st.
Trump's announcement was made in a letter to Prime Minister Mark Carney.
The letter was posted on Truth Social.
Trump stated that Fentanyl was the reason for the higher tariff rate.
Secretary of State Marco Rubio met with China's Foreign Minister in Malaysia.
This was the first in-person meeting between Marco Rubio and China's Foreign Minister.
Trade tensions between the US and China are ongoing.
Marco Rubio indicated that a summit between President Trump and Xi is likely.
Google has reportedly reached a deal to provide cloud computing services for the US government.
The cloud computing services deal with Google is at a heavily discounted price.
The Financial Times reported on Google's cloud deal.
The Google-US government deal could be finalized within weeks.
Oracle finalized a similar cloud computing deal with the US government last week.
Apple is planning a slate of new product releases for the first half of 2026.
New Apple products include a new low-end iPhone.
Apple plans to release multiple iPads.
Upgraded Mac computers are also part of Apple's 2026 product plans.
The information on Apple's plans comes from a Bloomberg report.
The Bloomberg report cited sources familiar with Apple's strategies.
Flutter Entertainment has reached a deal to acquire full ownership of FanDuel.
FanDuel is identified as a sports betting platform.
Flutter Entertainment is purchasing Boyd Gaming's 5% stake in FanDuel.
The cost for Boyd Gaming's stake in FanDuel is $1.76 billion.
The deal values the entire FanDuel company at $31 billion.
Flutter states that FanDuel holds 43% of the sports betting market.

timeline_events.event_description: President Trump announced tariffs of 35% on imports from Canada, effective August 1st.
Secretary of State Marco Rubio met with China's Foreign Minister in Malaysia, marking their first in-person meeting amidst ongoing trade tensions.
Following his meeting, Secretary of State Marco Rubio stated that a summit between President Trump and Xi is likely.
Google has reportedly reached a deal to provide cloud computing services for the US government at a heavily discounted price.
Oracle cut a similar cloud computing deal with the US government last week.
Apple is reportedly planning a slate of new product releases for the first half of 2026, including a new low-end iPhone, multiple iPads, and upgraded Mac computers.
Flutter Entertainment has reached a deal to take full ownership of sports betting platform FanDuel by buying Boyd Gaming's 5% stake for $1.76 billion.

temporal_patterns.description: Tariffs announced by President Trump are set to become effective on August 1st.
temporal_patterns.significance: Indicates the start date of a new economic policy.

temporal_patterns.description: The meeting between Secretary of State Marco Rubio and China's Foreign Minister is their first in-person interaction, marking a new phase in diplomatic engagement.
temporal_patterns.significance: Marks a new beginning in diplomatic relations amidst ongoing tensions.

temporal_patterns.description: Trade tensions between the US and China are continuing, providing context for current diplomatic efforts.
The Google cloud computing deal with the US government is expected to be finalized within weeks.
temporal_patterns.significance: Indicates an anticipated completion timeframe for the deal.

temporal_patterns.description: Oracle completed a similar cloud computing deal with the US government last week, preceding Google's current deal.
temporal_patterns.significance: Provides context and a precedent for Google's deal.

temporal_patterns.description: Apple is planning multiple new product releases, including a low-end iPhone, multiple iPads, and upgraded Mac computers, during the first half of 2026.
